name: California
description: California's medical card program allows qualified patients to access medical cannabis for approved conditions. The program requires a physician's recommendation and annual renewal.

name: New York
description: New York offers a comprehensive medical marijuana program with various qualifying conditions. Patients must register with the state and receive certification from a registered practitioner.

name: Florida
description: Florida's medical cannabis program serves patients with debilitating medical conditions. The state requires registration through the Office of Medical Marijuana Use.

name: Texas
description: Texas has a limited Compassionate Use Program for patients with specific qualifying conditions. The program has strict requirements and limited qualifying conditions.

name: Colorado
description: Colorado was one of the first states to establish a medical marijuana program. The state offers a well-established system with protections for qualified patients.

name: Washington
description: Washington State provides a medical marijuana authorization database for qualifying patients. The program offers certain legal protections and tax exemptions.

name: Arizona
description: Arizona's medical marijuana program serves patients with qualifying debilitating medical conditions. The state maintains a confidential registry of medical marijuana cardholders.

name: Massachusetts
description: Massachusetts offers a medical use of marijuana program for patients with qualifying conditions. The program requires certification from a registered healthcare provider.

name: Michigan
description: Michigan's medical marihuana program protects qualified patients who use marijuana for medical purposes. The state issues registry identification cards to approved patients.

name: Oregon
description: Oregon Medical Marijuana Program (OMMP) allows people with certain medical conditions to use marijuana for medical purposes. The program requires physician approval and state registration.
